moves.1. Nf3: Tal opens with this unuisual but flexible move.
moves.1... g6 2. e4: With Timman's passive response, Tal elects to seize the center at once.
moves.9... Nd5 10. O-O: Securing the King before embarking on an attack.
moves.10... Nd7 11. h3: Putting the question. The correct answer is 11.. BxN 12 NxB P-K3, fixing the White P at K5 as an immobile target.
moves.12... Qc7 13. Nf1: Preparing to reposition for K-side attack.
moves.13... Rad8 14. Ng3: Moving the final gun into place.
moves.16... f6 17. Bh6: Threatening to remove the valuable fianchettoed Bishop. The only move to hold the position is 17... N-B4, threatening to remove White's B in turn. [If Timman tries to preserve the B with 17... B-R1, Tal has 18 N-Q4 N-B4 19 N-K4! P-KN4 20 NxNP! winning.]
moves.17... Nxe5 18. Rxe5: Tal instantly pounces on Timman's scond mistake. The end falls quickly.
moves.19... Bf6 20. Nxe6: Timman resigns. If 20... BxQ, Tal wins easily with 21 NxQ followed by the win of the Rook on K1.

players: Mikhail Tal (Soviet Union) vs. Jan Timman (Holland)
